titles.title: A bill to replace certain Coastal Barrier Resources System maps.
A bill to replace certain Coastal Barrier Resources System maps.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Environment and Public Works.
Committee on Environment and Public Works. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.
Committee on Environment and Public Works. Reported by Senator Inhofe without amendment. With written report No. 108-179.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 354.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Referred to the House Committee on Resources.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Fisheries Conservation, Wildlife and Oceans.
Mr. Renzi moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 1663.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Message on House action received in Senate and at desk: House amendment to Senate bill.

vote.text: Senate agreed to House amendment by Unanimous Consent.

reference.label: text as Senate agreed to House amendment

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

bill.summary:
(This measure has not been amended since it was passed by the House on June 14, 2004. The summary of that version is repeated here.)
Replaces two maps relating to the Coastal Barrier Resources System Cape Fear Unit NC-07P.
Directs the Secretary of the Interior to keep such maps on file and available for inspection in accordance with the Coastal Barrier Resources Act.
